Deficiency Narrative: It was determined staff showed as active status since 03/30/25, however this staff was never employed by the operation
Correction Narrative: The CEO has indicated that the operation has conducted a comprehensive review of all submitted background checks and has taken the necessary steps to deactivate any employees who are no longer associated with the facility. Furthermore, the administrator will conduct weekly audits to ensure that all disassociated staff or Non interested employees have been inactivated within the required timeframe.

Deficiency Narrative: During inspection inspector was notified the treatment director had recently left the operation. This time the operation does not have a treatment director.
Correction Narrative:
On July 25, 2025, the CEO stated that the facility is actively searching for a treatment director. A post was published on WorkSource and other platforms to fill the position.

On August 14, 2025, the CEO sent an email with information about the new Treatment Director appointed by the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: The child records reviewed during inspection did not include the child orientation. The operation could not provide the child orientation.
Correction Narrative:
On August 13, 2025, the CEO stated via email that the operation will ensure all required topics are discussed during the resident orientation. This will ensure the children are aware of their rights and the facility's expectations. The staff responsible for going through the orientation handbook with the child will ensure they go through the entire handbook. The CEO also stated that the handbook will be available to all residents who would like to review it or have questions. CC created a checklist to ensure that all orientation subjects are discussed with children at the time of admission. Additionally, staff will conduct a monthly audit to ensure all required documentation is readily available when requested.

The CEO provided copies of the resident orientation handbook and the checklist that will be used during intake to ensure that all required documentation is completed. All required topics from the orientation were included in the audit form.

Deficiency Narrative: An employee that was no longer employeed since the beginning of May still shows active.
Correction Narrative:
The operation has indicated that the administrator or designee will be responsible for inactivating individuals who no longer work with the operation. This task will be completed within seven days after the individual is no longer associated with the operation.
The operation indicates that the administrator or designee will be provided with training on the expectations and standards for background check validation as needed if the compliance is not being met. Furthermore, the administrator, manager, or supervisor will conduct an audit of all former employees within seven days of the termination of their employment.

Deficiency Narrative: An admission assessment was observed to only have the resident's name and date.
Correction Narrative:
On May 28, 2025, the operation provided the following response: Admission Assessment will be completed, signed and dated by the service provider on the date of assessment.
If compliance is not met the Service provider will receive proper training from the administrator/ manager on the expectations and standard for admission assessments.
The administrator/manager will be responsible for ensuring the admission assessment is completed, signed and dated by the service provider.
An audit will be done by the administrator/manager/supervisor on all resident placement paperwork one week after a resident is placed in the facility. This will be put in place so no further citations will be given for this standard and any similar standards. A routine monthly audit will also be done to ensure all paperwork is complete and accurate.

Deficiency Narrative: Discrepancies were observed in the admission assessment that was evaluated. The front page of the admission assessment is dated 04/29/2025 as the date of the assessment.  However, the second page states that the date of the assessment is 11/29/2022 and the expected or actual placement date is 11/29/2022.  Additionally, the documentation, on page 7, references a different operation will be meeting the needs of the child instead of the current placement.  Similar discrepancies were also observed in the preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative:
On May 28, 2025, the operation provided the following response: The Admission Assessment will be completed with true and accurate information with complete records of the childs information.  
If compliance is not met the case manager will receive proper training from the administrator/ manager on the expectations and standard for admission assessments and the accuracy of the childs records and information.
The administrator/manager will be responsible for ensuring the childs records are accurate and current.
An audit will be done by the administrator/manager/supervisor on all resident placement paperwork one week after a resident is placed in the facility. This will be put in place so no further citations will be given for this standard and any similar standards. A routine monthly audit will also be done to ensure all paperwork is complete and accurate.

Deficiency Narrative: Resident face sheet indicates a terminated employee is the normalcy designee.
Correction Narrative:
On May 28, 2025, the operation provided the following response: The face sheet will be updated when personnel or designated persons have changed for the childs record.
The face sheet will be changed to show accurate information for the childs records as personnel or designated persons change on the caseload.  If compliance is not met the case manager/supervisor will receive proper training from the administrator/ manager on the expectations and standard for the face sheets of the residents. The administrator/manager will be responsible for ensuring the childs face sheets are updated and current. A meeting will take place to ensure all personnel that are responsible for paperwork are aware of any and all changes, such as termination of an employee. This allows for all paperwork to be updated in a timely manner.
An audit will be done by the administrator/manager/supervisor on all residents paperwork after there are any changes in personnel or designated persons for the child. This will be put in place so no further citations will be given for this standard and any similar standards. A routine monthly audit will also be done to ensure all paperwork is complete and accurate. 

Additionally, the operation corrected the face sheets and submitted them to Licensing.
